transcript: - You guys, WWDC is gonna be here before we know it. I'm so excited. It's next week. It is gonna be here so so soon and with that comes more rumors. And one of the big things, obviously, that they talk about at WWDC because, it is a developer's conference, is software. So IOS 13 is gonna be the next release of IOS and the thing that I'm most excited about is dark mode. All of the apps that we have, especially Mojave, now with their dark mode update, it's been a long time coming, that iOS needs to have this option. What I have actually set up, I will do a triple click and just like inverts all the colors. It's like fake dark mode. So we'll triple click, and it takes us back to normal. But an actual dark mode, is something that is it's gotta be, it has to be. There are some screen shot links we have over here. So here it is. Dark mode iOS 13 will include dark mode for the first time. I remember when they originally announced Mojave with dark mode, that was a huge deal and I don't think I've ever turned it off. That is so something that they should have done a long time ago! It always drives me crazy because the volume is over top of whatever it is that you're watching, so that takes up so much screen real estate. Oh, iPad tweaks! Just I would like to see a show of hands. You can put your hand raises in the comments below. I have used it so many times. I use my Apple Watch so many times throughout the day, (dinging) to find my iPhone. It says it's working on an all new app that combines Find My Friends and Find My Phone into one. The app is expected to be called "Find My" which will include a new "find network" feature. Be tracked down even when not connected to Wi-Fi or cellular network, oh wow, by leveraging other nearby devices. That is actually really, really incredible. What that means, is if your phone is in airplane mode, or not even connected to Wi-Fi or cellular, you'll be able to find it. My sister had her laptop stolen. It was in the airport and she was getting a massage at one of those like airport massage kiosks and somebody just came down, swiped it. We tried to get security footage, but nothing ever really came of it, unfortunately. But what this means, is if you do lose something like that and it is lost and it's not connected to Wi-Fi, using other devices around it, you'll be able to find that missing item. It would be interesting if somehow Apple ends up buying Tile, if you guys are familiar with Tile. I did a video on this so long ago, but I have Tiles in all of my things, all of my back packs, all of my luggages, suitcases, everything. The only downside to Tile is it's not GPS but it does rely on it's network of other Tile users so using blue tooth, they're all constantly connecting to each other. So if you do mark an item as lost, that item then goes into lost mode and then it's continually pinging, looking for other Tiles around it to help you locate that lost item. So I feel like that's something that Apple is -- It's so easy to do.
